abstracts.cdata!:
The Investigation Report for the Mining
            Development and Environmental Control Technical Assistance
            Project in Ecuador examines the claims given by Requesters
            in regard to this project.  The Requesters claim that the
            communities they represent are likely to suffer material
            harm as a result of failures and omissions of the Bank in
            the design and implementation of the Project.  They claim
            that public release of maps with mineral data will attract
            mining companies and "informal" miners.  This
            would result in significant degradation of critical natural
            habitats. Management examined the claims and found that the
            Request was eligible for and Investigation. After examining
            the policies and procedures followed for the Project, the
            Investigation Report finds that the Bank was in compliance
            with numerous policies and procedures, but was inefficient
            in following environmental assessment procedures.
